events.message: The applicant completed and submitted the personal loan application online, indicating the purpose is to cover medical expenses and some existing debt consolidation.
The application was reviewed by the system and correctly categorised under Personal Loan due to keywords such as medical and debt mentioned in the purpose.
Loan officer Sarah Williams was assigned to the case to handle communications and guide the applicant through the loan process.
During the initial review, the officer evaluated the application details and determined that additional documents need to be requested for verification.
Requested income statements, medical bills, and proof of existing debts from the applicant to verify financial situation and loan eligibility.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documentation, including pay slips, medical receipts, and credit card statements for debt verification.
The credit bureau report was retrieved and analyzed, showing a moderate credit score with no significant delinquencies or defaults.
Risk assessment was performed based on submitted documents and credit history, concluding the applicant is a medium-risk client for this personal loan.
A loan offer with a competitive interest rate and repayment schedule was formally extended to the applicant via email and online portal.
Applicant responded confirming understanding of the terms and expressing acceptance of the loan offer and repayment conditions.
Loan approval was officially granted by the credit committee after verifying all compliance and eligibility criteria were satisfactorily met.
The approved loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicantâ€™s designated bank account to cover the medical bills and debt payments.
Follow-up contact made with the applicant to ensure funds were received and to provide information about repayment process and support.
The loan case was successfully closed after confirming applicant satisfaction and completion of all required formalities in the file.
